title: Hasanids
text:
The Hasanids ( or , ) are the descendants of <a href="Hasan%20ibn%20Ali">Hasan ibn Ali</a>, a grandson of the Islamic prophet <a href="Muhammad">Muhammad</a>.
They are a branch of the <a href="Alids">Alids</a> (the descendants of <a href="Ali">Ali ibn Abi Talib</a>), and one of the two most important branches of the (the other being the descendants of Hasan's brother <a href="Husayn%20ibn%20Ali">Husayn</a>, the <a href="Husaynids">Husaynids</a>).
In <a href="Morocco">Morocco</a>, the term is particularly applied to the descendants of <a href="Muhammad%20al-Nafs%20al-Zakiyya">Muhammad al-Nafs al-Zakiyya</a>, to distinguish them from the <a href="Idrisid%20dynasty">Idrisid dynasty</a>, which is also of Hasanid descent. The Moroccan Hasanids proper have produced two dynasties, the <a href="Saadi%20Sultanate">Saadi dynasty</a> and the <a href="Alaouite%20dynasty">Alaouite dynasty</a>, which still reigns over the country.
